Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'prehistory' to someone reading at the Upper Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 50 words that follows your plan. Remember to use transition words to help the reader follow your ideas.

Before history was written down, there was a time called prehistory. This period started with the first humans and ended when people began to write. It was a time of big changes. Early humans learned to make tools, build homes, and grow food. They also learned to communicate with each other. This was a very important time in human history.

Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'prehistory' to someone reading at the Upper Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 50 words that follows your plan. Here's an example of what your paragraph might look like:

Prehistory is a time long before people started writing things down. It started at the beginning of the world and lasted until around 3,000 years ago. During this time, people lived as hunters and gatherers, using tools made from stones and bones. They didn't have houses, so they lived in caves or built shelters from plants. This time period is sometimes called the 'Stone Age'.

Text:
Step 1: Think about how to explain 'prehistory' to someone reading at the Upper Elementary level.
Step 2: Select appropriate vocabulary and sentence structure.
Step 3: Write a paragraph of 50 words that follows your plan. Here's a possible solution:
Before people could write, they didn't leave many records. So, this time period is called prehistory. It started around 2.5 million years ago. During prehistory, people were hunter-gatherers. They lived in small groups and moved around a lot. They didn't farm or live in cities. Instead, they got food by hunting animals and gathering plants. They made tools and art from natural materials. Even though we don't have many written records, archaeologists study the things people left behind to learn about their lives.
